snippet: City officials are hoping to refine their data on issues like crime, housing for veterans and Wi-Fi availability and turn them into a single score intended to reflect the city’s overall progress.
abstract: Office of Boston Mayor Martin J Walsh will announce effort to combine data collected on variety of issues into single numerical score called CityScore, meant to reflect city's overall performance; experts say plan is pioneer in effort to capitalize on plethora of data available to improve government accountability; initiative comes as many cities, including Los Angeles, New York and Houston, make data and analytics a hallmark of 21st-century governance.
lead_paragraph: City officials are hoping to refine their data on issues like crime, housing for veterans and Wi-Fi availability and turn them into a single score intended to reflect the city’s overall progress.

headline.print_headline: Tracking Boston’s Progress With Just One Number
headline.main: Tracking Boston’s Progress With Just One Number
